meanings.definition: A thick disc of stone or other abrasive material used for sharpening tools or shaping metal.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith used a grindstone to sharpen his tools.
meanings.sent2: The grindstones at the workshop were worn down from constant use.
meanings.sent3: When the grindstone started singing, everyone knew it was time for a break.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a grindstone, shaping her into a stronger person.
meanings.sent5: The sparks flew as the grindstone met the dull blade, transforming it into a sharp tool.

meanings.definition: A source of laborious, routine work.
meanings.sent1: The endless paperwork felt like a heavy grindstone on his shoulders.
meanings.sent2: Working in the factory felt like being stuck between two grindstones.
meanings.sent3: The grindstone of daily chores never seemed to stop turning.
meanings.sent4: The project deadline was a looming grindstone, pushing everyone to work harder.
meanings.sent5: She felt trapped in a cycle of grindstones, yearning for a change in routine.
